verses.verse: Then Eliphaz <S%H464><s%> the Temanite <S%H8489><s%> answered, <S%H6030><s%>
"Can a man <S%H1397><s%> be profitable <S%H5532><s%> to God? <S%H410><s%> Surely <S%H3588><s%> he who is wise <S%H7919><s%> is profitable to himself. <S%H5532><s%>

Is it any pleasure <S%H2656><s%> to the Almighty, <S%H7706><s%> that you are righteous? <S%H6663><s%> Or does it benefit <S%H1215><s%> him, <S%H1870><s%> that you make your ways perfect? <S%H8552><s%>
Is it for your piety <S%H3374><s%> that he reproves <S%H3198><s%> you, <S%H935><s%> that he enters with you into judgment? <S%H4941><s%>
Isn't <S%H7451><s%> your wickedness great? <S%H7227><s%> Neither is there any end <S%H7093><s%> to your iniquities. <S%H5771><s%>
For you have taken pledges <S%H2254><s%> from your brother <S%H251><s%> for nothing, <S%H2600><s%> and stripped <S%H6584><s%> the naked <S%H6174><s%> of their clothing. <S%H899><s%>
You haven't <S%H4325><s%> given water to the weary <S%H5889><s%> to drink, <S%H8248><s%> and you have withheld <S%H4513><s%> bread <S%H3899><s%> from the hungry. <S%H7457><s%>
But as for the mighty <S%H2220><s%> man, <S%H376><s%> he had the earth. <S%H776><s%> The honorable man, <S%H5375><s%> he lived in it. <S%H3427><s%>
You have sent <S%H7971><s%> widows <S%H490><s%> away empty, <S%H7387><s%> and the arms <S%H2220><s%> of the fatherless <S%H3490><s%> have been broken. <S%H1792><s%>
Therefore snares <S%H6341><s%> are around <S%H5439><s%> you. <S%H6597><s%> Sudden fear <S%H6343><s%> troubles you, <S%H926><s%>
or darkness, <S%H2822><s%> so that you can not see, <S%H7200><s%> and floods <S%H8229><s%> of waters <S%H4325><s%> cover you. <S%H3680><s%>
"Isn't <S%H433><s%> God in the heights <S%H1363><s%> of heaven? <S%H8064><s%> See <S%H7200><s%> the height <S%H1363><s%> of the stars, <S%H3556><s%> how high they are! <S%H7311><s%>
You say, <S%H559><s%> <S%H410><s%> 'What does God know? <S%H3045><s%> Can he judge <S%H8199><s%> through the thick darkness? <S%H6205><s%>
Thick clouds <S%H5645><s%> are a covering <S%H5643><s%> to him, <S%H7200><s%> so that he doesn't see. He walks <S%H1980><s%> on the vault <S%H2329><s%> of the sky. <S%H8064><s%>'
Will you keep <S%H8104><s%> the old <S%H5769><s%> way, <S%H734><s%> which wicked <S%H205><s%> men <S%H4962><s%> have trodden, <S%H1869><s%>
who were snatched away <S%H7059><s%> before their time, <S%H6256><s%> whose foundation <S%H3247><s%> was poured <S%H3332><s%> out as a stream, <S%H5104><s%>
who said <S%H559><s%> to God, <S%H410><s%> <S%H5493><s%> 'Depart from us; <S%H7706><s%>' and, 'What can the Almighty do for us? <S%H6466><s%>'
Yet he filled <S%H4390><s%> their houses <S%H1004><s%> with good <S%H2896><s%> things, <S%H6098><s%> but the counsel of the wicked <S%H7563><s%> is far from me. <S%H7368><s%>
The righteous <S%H6662><s%> see <S%H7200><s%> it, <S%H8055><s%> and are glad. The innocent <S%H5355><s%> ridicule them, <S%H3932><s%>
saying, <S%H518><s%> 'Surely those who rose up against <S%H7009><s%> us are cut off. <S%H3582><s%> The fire <S%H784><s%> has consumed <S%H398><s%> their remnant. <S%H3499><s%>'
"Acquaint <S%H5532><s%> yourself with him, <S%H7999><s%> now, and be at peace. Thereby good <S%H2896><s%> shall come to you. <S%H935><s%>
Please receive <S%H3947><s%> instruction <S%H8451><s%> from his mouth, <S%H6310><s%> and lay up <S%H7760><s%> his words <S%H561><s%> in your heart. <S%H3824><s%>

If you return <S%H7725><s%> to the Almighty, <S%H7706><s%> you shall be built up, <S%H1129><s%> if you put away <S%H7368><s%> unrighteousness <S%H5766><s%> far <S%H7368><s%> from your tents. <S%H168><s%>
Lay <S%H7896><s%> your treasure <S%H1220><s%> in <S%H5921><s%> the dust, <S%H6083><s%> the gold of Ophir <S%H211><s%> among the stones <S%H6697><s%> of the brooks. <S%H5158><s%>
The Almighty <S%H7706><s%> will be your treasure, <S%H1220><s%> and precious <S%H8443><s%> silver to you. <S%H3701><s%>
For then you will delight <S%H6026><s%> yourself in the Almighty, <S%H7706><s%> and shall lift up <S%H5375><s%> your face <S%H6440><s%> to God. <S%H433><s%>
You shall make your prayer <S%H6279><s%> to him, <S%H8085><s%> and he will hear you. <S%H7999><s%> You shall pay your vows. <S%H5088><s%>
You shall also decree <S%H1504><s%> a thing, <S%H562><s%> and it shall be established <S%H6965><s%> to you. <S%H216><s%> Light shall shine <S%H5050><s%> on your ways. <S%H1870><s%>
When they cast down, <S%H8213><s%> you shall say, <S%H559><s%> <S%H1466><s%> 'be lifted up.' He will save <S%H3467><s%> the humble <S%H7807><s%> person. <S%H5869><s%>
He will even deliver <S%H4422><s%> him <S%H336><s%> who is not innocent. <S%H5355><s%> Yes, <S%H4422><s%> he shall be delivered through the cleanness <S%H1252><s%> of your hands. <S%H3709><s%>"
